caption.p: a,b) Cyclic voltammetry of gold (thin gap disk electrode) in (20 % O 2+80 % Ar)‐saturated 0.1 m Ca(ClO 4) 2 containing DMSO at 20 mV s −1 and 4 Hz rotation frequency vs Ag/Ag + in a usual H‐Cell. The disk current (a) is normalized to the geometrical electrode surface area and the ring current (b) is normalized to the theoretical collection efficiency ( N 0) and the geometrical WE surface area. The ring potential was varied as indicated by the color code. c,d) Cyclic voltammetry of gold (exchange disk electrode) in (20 % O 2+80 % Ar)‐saturated 0.1 m Ca(ClO 4) 2 containing DMSO at 20 mV s −1 and 4 Hz rotation frequency vs Ag/Ag + in a usual H‐Cell. The disk current (c) is normalized to the geometrical electrode surface area and the ring current (d) is normalized to the theoretical collection efficiency ( N 0) and the geometrical WE surface area. The ring potential was 0.4 V. The electrode roughness of the disk electrodes in (c) were f R≈3 for both, while the ring electrode was polished (dashed line) or roughened (solid line). The arrows (b,d) indicate the sweep direction. Data is smoothed by using the Savitzky‐Golay method with 25 points of window.
